subject: RE: [junit] Has someone done Servlet JUnit tests?
msgSnippet: I haven t written any tests for servlets, but there s a lot out there for it.  You can take a look at HTTPUnit or Cactus (links for both can be found at
messageBody:
I haven't written any tests for servlets, but there's a lot out there for
it. You can take a look at HTTPUnit or Cactus (links for both can be found
at http://www.junit.org/extensions.htm). Also, read a little on the
following WIKI pages:
http://c2.com/cgi/wiki?JavaUnit (the 'official' JUnit WIKI page)
http://c2.com/cgi/wiki?ServletUnitTest
http://c2.com/cgi/wiki?JunitServlet

HTH.
-Jason

> -----Original Message-----
> From: Peter Qi [mailto:Peter.Qi@...]
> Sent: Saturday, June 16, 2001 2:58 PM
> To: junit@yahoogroups.com
> Subject: [junit] Has someone done Servlet JUnit tests?
>
>
> Hi,
>
> I need to create some JUnit tests for a Servlet. But because the
> doGet(HttpServletRequest, HttpServletResponse) and
> doPost(HttpServletRequest, HttpServletResponse) methods
> have no returns,
> and HttpServletRequest and HttpServletResponse are
> generated by the
> system, I could not create JUnit tests for them. Does
> anyone have some
> experience? Thanks a lot for the help.
>
> Peter Qi
>
